1.Name: Schindler's List
1.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes, Ben Kingsley
1.Outline: In Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

2.Name: Airlift
2.Credit: Dir: Raja Menon With: Akshay Kumar, Nimrat Kaur, Taranjit Kaur
2.Outline: When Iraq invades Kuwait in August, 1990, a callous Indian businessman becomes the spokesperson for more than 170,000 stranded countrymen.

3.Name: Goodfellas
3.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, Joe Pesci
3.Outline: Henry Hill and his friends work their way up through the mob hierarchy.

4.Name: The Message
4.Credit: Dir: Moustapha Akkad With: Anthony Quinn, Irene Papas, Michael Ansara
4.Outline: This must-see epic depicts the birth of Islam. In the 7th century Mohammed is visited by Angel Gabriel...

5.Name: The Intouchables
5.Credit: Dir: Olivier Nakache, Eric Toledano With: FranÃ§ois Cluzet, Omar Sy, Anne Le Ny
5.Outline: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

6.Name: The Pianist
6.Credit: Dir: Roman Polanski With: Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann, Frank Finlay
6.Outline: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

7.Name: Braveheart
7.Credit: Dir: Mel Gibson With: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan
7.Outline: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

8.Name: Lawrence of Arabia
8.Credit: Dir: David Lean With: Peter O'Toole, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn
8.Outline: Follows a brilliant, flamboyant and controversial British military figure and his conflicted loyalties during wartime service.

9.Name: Amadeus
9.Credit: Dir: Milos Forman With: F. Murray Abraham, Tom Hulce, Elizabeth Berridge
9.Outline: The incredible story of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, told by his peer and secret rival Antonio Salieri - now confined to an insane asylum.

10.Name: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag
10.Credit: Dir: Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra With: Farhan Akhtar, Sonam Kapoor, Pavan Malhotra
10.Outline: The truth behind the ascension of Milkha "The Flying Sikh" Singh who was scarred because of the India-Pakistan partition.

11.Name: Downfall
11.Credit: Dir: Oliver Hirschbiegel With: Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Ulrich Matthes
11.Outline: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

12.Name: Raging Bull
12.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Robert De Niro, Cathy Moriarty, Joe Pesci
12.Outline: An emotionally self-destructive boxer's journey through life, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring, destroys his life outside it.

13.Name: The Wolf of Wall Street
13.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie
13.Outline: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort , from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

14.Name: The Elephant Man
14.Credit: Dir: David Lynch With: Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, Anne Bancroft
14.Outline: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous facade, there is revealed a person of intelligence and sensitivity.

15.Name: Casino
15.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Robert De Niro, Sharon Stone, Joe Pesci
15.Outline: Greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two mobster best friends and a trophy wife over a gambling empire.

16.Name: A Beautiful Mind
16.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Russell Crowe, Ed Harris, Jennifer Connelly
16.Outline: After a brilliant but asocial mathematician, [link=nm1171285], accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

17.Name: Into the Wild
17.Credit: Dir: Sean Penn With: Emile Hirsch, Vince Vaughn, Catherine Keener
17.Outline: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

18.Name: Rush
18.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Daniel BrÃ¼hl, Chris Hemsworth, Olivia Wilde
18.Outline: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda .

19.Name: Spotlight
19.Credit: Dir: Tom McCarthy With: Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams
19.Outline: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

20.Name: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
20.Credit: Dir: George Roy Hill With: Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Katharine Ross
20.Outline: Two Western bank/train robbers flee to Bolivia when the law gets too close.

21.Name: In the Name of the Father
21.Credit: Dir: Jim Sheridan With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Alison Crosbie
21.Outline: A man's coerced confession to an IRA bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.

22.Name: 12 Years a Slave
22.Credit: Dir: Steve McQueen With: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Kenneth Williams, Michael Fassbender
22.Outline: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup , a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

23.Name: Gandhi
23.Credit: Dir: Richard Attenborough With: Ben Kingsley, John Gielgud, Candice Bergen
23.Outline: Gandhi's character is fully explained as a man of nonviolence. Through his patience, he is able to drive the British out of the subcontinent. And the stubborn nature of Jinnah and his commitment towards Pakistan is portrayed.

24.Name: Ip Man
24.Credit: Dir: Wilson Yip With: Donnie Yen, Simon Yam, Siu-Wong Fan
24.Outline: A semi-biographical account of Yip Man, the successful martial arts master who taught the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun to the world.

25.Name: The Imitation Game
25.Credit: Dir: Morten Tyldum With: Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode
25.Outline: During World War II, mathematician Alan Turing tries to crack the enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.

26.Name: The Sea Inside
26.Credit: Dir: Alejandro AmenÃ¡bar With: Javier Bardem, BelÃ©n Rueda, Lola DueÃ±as
26.Outline: The factual story of Spaniard Ramon Sampedro, who fought a thirty-year campaign in favor of euthanasia and his own right to die.

27.Name: Persepolis
27.Credit: Dir: Vincent Paronnaud, Marjane Satrapi With: Chiara Mastroianni, Catherine Deneuve, Gena Rowlands
27.Outline: A precocious and outspoken Iranian girl grows up during the Islamic Revolution.

28.Name: Papillon
28.Credit: Dir: Franklin J. Schaffner With: Steve McQueen, Dustin Hoffman, Victor Jory
28.Outline: A man befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence on a dreadful prison island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.

29.Name: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
29.Credit: Dir: Julian Schnabel With: Mathieu Amalric, Emmanuelle Seigner, Marie-JosÃ©e Croze
29.Outline: The true story of Elle editor Jean-Dominique Bauby who suffers a stroke and has to live with an almost totally paralyzed body; only his left eye isn't paralyzed.

30.Name: The King's Speech
30.Credit: Dir: Tom Hooper With: Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter
30.Outline: The story of King George VI of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, his impromptu ascension to the throne and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch become worthy of it.

31.Name: Catch Me If You Can
31.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken
31.Outline: The true story of Frank Abagnale Jr. who, before his 19th birthday, successfully conned millions of dollars' worth of checks as a Pan Am pilot, doctor, and legal prosecutor.

32.Name: Patton
32.Credit: Dir: Franklin J. Schaffner With: George C. Scott, Karl Malden, Stephen Young
32.Outline: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

33.Name: The Straight Story
33.Credit: Dir: David Lynch With: Richard Farnsworth, Sissy Spacek, Jane Galloway Heitz
33.Outline: An old man makes a long journey by lawn-mover tractor to mend his relationship with an ill brother.

34.Name: Waltz with Bashir
34.Credit: Dir: Ari Folman With: Ari Folman, Ron Ben-Yishai, Ronny Dayag
34.Outline: An Israeli film director interviews fellow veterans of the 1982 invasion of Lebanon to reconstruct his own memories of his term of service in that conflict.

35.Name: Cinderella Man
35.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Russell Crowe, RenÃ©e Zellweger, Craig Bierko
35.Outline: The story of James Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to become a champion and an inspiration in the 1930s.

36.Name: All the President's Men
36.Credit: Dir: Alan J. Pakula With: Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford, Jack Warden
36.Outline: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon 's resignation.

37.Name: The Sound of Music
37.Credit: Dir: Robert Wise With: Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Eleanor Parker
37.Outline: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

38.Name: Dallas Buyers Club
38.Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Matthew McConaughey, Jennifer Garner, Jared Leto
38.Outline: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

39.Name: Straight Outta Compton
39.Credit: Dir: F. Gary Gray With: O'Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell
39.Outline: The group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.

40.Name: The Pursuit of Happyness
40.Credit: Dir: Gabriele Muccino With: Will Smith, Thandie Newton, Jaden Smith
40.Outline: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional endeavor.

41.Name: Spartacus
41.Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons
41.Outline: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

42.Name: Bonnie and Clyde
42.Credit: Dir: Arthur Penn With: Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway, Michael J. Pollard
42.Outline: A somewhat romanticized account of the career of the notoriously violent bank robbing couple and their gang.

43.Name: The Insider
43.Credit: Dir: Michael Mann With: Russell Crowe, Al Pacino, Christopher Plummer
43.Outline: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a "60 Minutes" expose on Big Tobacco.

44.Name: Ed Wood
44.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Johnny Depp, Martin Landau, Sarah Jessica Parker
44.Outline: An ambitious but troubled movie director tries his best to fulfill his dream, despite his lack of support.

45.Name: Walk the Line
45.Credit: Dir: James Mangold With: Joaquin Phoenix, Reese Witherspoon, Ginnifer Goodwin
45.Outline: A chronicle of country music legend Johnny Cash 's life, from his early days on an Arkansas cotton farm to his rise to fame with Sun Records in Memphis, where he recorded alongside Elvis Presley , Jerry Lee Lewis , and Carl Perkins .

46.Name: The Ten Commandments
46.Credit: Dir: Cecil B. DeMille With: Charlton Heston, Yul Brynner, Anne Baxter
46.Outline: The Egyptian Prince, Moses, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

47.Name: My Left Foot
47.Credit: Dir: Jim Sheridan With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Brenda Fricker, Alison Whelan
47.Outline: Christy Brown, born with cerebral palsy, learns to paint and write with his only controllable limb - his left foot.

48.Name: The Fighter
48.Credit: Dir: David O. Russell With: Mark Wahlberg, Christian Bale, Amy Adams
48.Outline: A look at the early years of boxer "Irish" Micky Ward and his brother who helped train him before going pro in the mid 1980s.

49.Name: Captain Phillips
49.Credit: Dir: Paul Greengrass With: Tom Hanks, Barkhad Abdi, Barkhad Abdirahman
49.Outline: The true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the US-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.

50.Name: The World's Fastest Indian
50.Credit: Dir: Roger Donaldson With: Anthony Hopkins, Diane Ladd, Iain Rea
50.Outline: The story of New Zealander Burt Munro, who spent years rebuilding a 1920 Indian motorcycle, which helped him set the land speed world record at Utah's Bonneville Salt Flats in 1967.

51.Name: Tombstone
51.Genre: Action | Biography | Drama | History | Romance | Western
51.Credit: Dir: George P. Cosmatos With: Kurt Russell, Val Kilmer, Sam Elliott
51.Outline: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona, are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

52.Name: The Big Short
52.Credit: Dir: Adam McKay With: Christian Bale, Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling
52.Outline: Four denizens in the world of high-finance predict the credit and housing bubble collapse of the mid-2000s, and decide to take on the big banks for their greed and lack of foresight.

53.Name: The Motorcycle Diaries
53.Credit: Dir: Walter Salles With: Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal, Rodrigo De la Serna, MÃ­a Maestro
53.Outline: The dramatization of a motorcycle road trip Che Guevara went on in his youth that showed him his life's calling.

54.Name: American Gangster
54.Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor
54.Outline: In 1970s America, a detective works to bring down the drug empire of Frank Lucas, a heroin kingpin from Manhattan, who is smuggling the drug into the country from the Far East.

55.Name: The Wind Rises
55.Credit: Dir: Hayao Miyazaki With: Hideaki Anno, Hidetoshi Nishijima, Miori Takimoto
55.Outline: A look at the life of Jiro Horikoshi, the man who designed Japanese fighter planes during World War II.

56.Name: October Sky
56.Credit: Dir: Joe Johnston With: Jake Gyllenhaal, Chris Cooper, Laura Dern
56.Outline: The true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes.

57.Name: The Last Emperor
57.Credit: Dir: Bernardo Bertolucci With: John Lone, Joan Chen, Peter O'Toole
57.Outline: The story of the final Emperor of China.

58.Name: Awakenings
58.Credit: Dir: Penny Marshall With: Robert De Niro, Robin Williams, Julie Kavner
58.Outline: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

59.Name: Donnie Brasco
59.Credit: Dir: Mike Newell With: Al Pacino, Johnny Depp, Michael Madsen
59.Outline: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.

60.Name: Pride
60.Credit: Dir: Matthew Warchus With: Bill Nighy, Imelda Staunton, Dominic West
60.Outline: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

61.Name: Serpico
61.Credit: Dir: Sidney Lumet With: Al Pacino, John Randolph, Jack Kehoe
61.Outline: The true story about an honest New York cop who blew the whistle on rampant corruption in the force only to have his comrades turn against him.

62.Name: Finding Neverland
62.Credit: Dir: Marc Forster With: Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Julie Christie
62.Outline: The story of J.M. Barrie 's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.

63.Name: Remember the Titans
63.Credit: Dir: Boaz Yakin With: Denzel Washington, Will Patton, Wood Harris
63.Outline: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.

64.Name: Il Postino: The Postman
64.Credit: Dir: Michael Radford With: Massimo Troisi, Philippe Noiret, Maria Grazia Cucinotta
64.Outline: Simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet; he uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.

65.Name: Argo
65.Credit: Dir: Ben Affleck With: Ben Affleck, Bryan Cranston, John Goodman
65.Outline: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1980.

66.Name: Control
66.Credit: Dir: Anton Corbijn With: Sam Riley, Samantha Morton, Craig Parkinson
66.Outline: A profile of Ian Curtis, the enigmatic singer of Joy Division whose personal, professional, and romantic troubles led him to commit suicide at the age of 23.

67.Name: The Social Network
67.Credit: Dir: David Fincher With: Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield, Justin Timberlake
67.Outline: Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, but is later sued by two brothers who claimed he stole their idea, and the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

68.Name: Ray
68.Credit: Dir: Taylor Hackford With: Jamie Foxx, Regina King, Kerry Washington
68.Outline: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.

69.Name: The Theory of Everything
69.Credit: Dir: James Marsh With: Eddie Redmayne, Felicity Jones, Tom Prior
69.Outline: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.

70.Name: Malcolm X
70.Credit: Dir: Spike Lee With: Denzel Washington, Angela Bassett, Delroy Lindo
70.Outline: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

71.Name: The Last King of Scotland
71.Credit: Dir: Kevin Macdonald With: James McAvoy, Forest Whitaker, Gillian Anderson
71.Outline: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s

72.Name: Shine
72.Credit: Dir: Scott Hicks With: Geoffrey Rush, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Justin Braine
72.Outline: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.

73.Name: The Blind Side
73.Credit: Dir: John Lee Hancock With: Quinton Aaron, Sandra Bullock, Tim McGraw
73.Outline: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All American football player and first round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

74.Name: Fearless
74.Credit: Dir: Ronny Yu With: Jet Li, Li Sun, Yong Dong
74.Outline: A biography of Chinese Martial Arts Master Huo Yuanjia, who is the founder and spiritual guru of the Jin Wu Sports Federation.

75.Name: Midnight Express
75.Credit: Dir: Alan Parker With: Brad Davis, Irene Miracle, Bo Hopkins
75.Outline: The true story of Billy Hayes, an American college student who is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

76.Name: La Vie en Rose
76.Credit: Dir: Olivier Dahan With: Marion Cotillard, Sylvie Testud, Pascal Greggory
76.Outline: The life story of singer Ãdith Piaf .

77.Name: Philomena
77.Credit: Dir: Stephen Frears With: Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Sophie Kennedy Clark
77.Outline: A world-weary political journalist picks up the story of a woman's search for her son, who was taken away from her decades ago after she became pregnant and was forced to live in a convent.

78.Name: Blow
78.Credit: Dir: Ted Demme With: Johnny Depp, PenÃ©lope Cruz, Franka Potente
78.Outline: The story of George Jung, the man who established the American cocaine market in the 1970s.

79.Name: 127 Hours
79.Credit: Dir: Danny Boyle With: James Franco, Amber Tamblyn, Kate Mara
79.Outline: An adventurous mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

80.Name: Milk
80.Credit: Dir: Gus Van Sant With: Sean Penn, Josh Brolin, Emile Hirsch
80.Outline: The story of Harvey Milk , and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

81.Name: Escape from Alcatraz
81.Credit: Dir: Don Siegel With: Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom
81.Outline: Alcatraz is the most secure prison of its time. It is believed that no one can ever escape from it, until three daring men make a possible successful attempt at escaping from the most infamous prisons in the world.

82.Name: A Royal Affair
82.Credit: Dir: Nikolaj Arcel With: Alicia Vikander, Mads Mikkelsen, Mikkel Boe FÃ¸lsgaard
82.Outline: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

83.Name: Hunger
83.Credit: Dir: Steve McQueen With: Stuart Graham, Laine Megaw, Brian Milligan
83.Outline: Irish republican Bobby Sands leads the inmates of a Northern Irish prison in a hunger strike.

84.Name: Ip Man 2
84.Credit: Dir: Wilson Yip With: Donnie Yen, Xiaoming Huang, Sammo Kam-Bo Hung
84.Outline: Centering on Ip Man's migration to Hong Kong in 1949 as he attempts to propagate his discipline of Wing Chun martial arts.

85.Name: Moneyball
85.Credit: Dir: Bennett Miller With: Brad Pitt, Robin Wright, Jonah Hill
85.Outline: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.

86.Name: The Great Debaters
86.Credit: Dir: Denzel Washington With: Denzel Washington, Forest Whitaker, Kimberly Elise
86.Outline: A drama based on the true story of Melvin B. Tolson, a professor at Wiley College Texas. In 1935, he inspired students to form the school's first debate team, which went on to challenge Harvard in the national championship.

87.Name: Mesrine Part 1: Killer Instinct
87.Credit: Dir: Jean-FranÃ§ois Richet With: Vincent Cassel, CÃ©cile De France, GÃ©rard Depardieu
87.Outline: The story of french gangster Jacques Mesrine, before he was called Public Enemy NÂ°1.

88.Name: Chaplin
88.Credit: Dir: Richard Attenborough With: Robert Downey Jr., Geraldine Chaplin, Paul Rhys
88.Outline: A film about the troubled and controversial life of the master comedy filmmaker Charles Chaplin .

89.Name: Boys Don't Cry
89.Credit: Dir: Kimberly Peirce With: Hilary Swank, ChloÃ« Sevigny, Peter Sarsgaard
89.Outline: Female born, Teena Brandon adopts his male identity of Brandon Teena and attempts to find himself and love in Nebraska.

90.Name: Lone Survivor
90.Credit: Dir: Peter Berg With: Mark Wahlberg, Taylor Kitsch, Emile Hirsch
90.Outline: Marcus Luttrell and his team set out on a mission to capture or kill notorious Taliban leader Ahmad Shah, in late June 2005. Marcus and his team are left to fight for their lives in one of the most valiant efforts of modern warfare.

91.Name: The Hurricane
91.Credit: Dir: Norman Jewison With: Denzel Washington, Vicellous Reon Shannon, Deborah Kara Unger
91.Outline: The story of Rubin "Hurricane" Carter, a boxer wrongly imprisoned for murder, and the people who aided in his fight to prove his innocence.

92.Name: The Damned United
92.Credit: Dir: Tom Hooper With: Colm Meaney, Henry Goodman, David Roper
92.Outline: The story of the controversial Brian Clough 's 44-day reign as the coach of the English football club Leeds United.

93.Name: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
93.Credit: Dir: Andrew Dominik With: Brad Pitt, Casey Affleck, Sam Shepard
93.Outline: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

94.Name: Rudy
94.Credit: Dir: David Anspaugh With: Sean Astin, Jon Favreau, Ned Beatty
94.Outline: Rudy has always been told that he was too small to play college football. But he is determined to overcome the odds and fulfill his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

95.Name: Good Night, and Good Luck.
95.Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: David Strathairn, George Clooney, Patricia Clarkson
95.Outline: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy .

96.Credit: Dir: Brian Helgeland With: Chadwick Boseman, T.R. Knight, Harrison Ford
96.Outline: The story of Jackie Robinson from his signing with the Brooklyn Dodgers organization in 1945 to his historic 1947 rookie season when he broke the color barrier in Major League Baseball.

97.Name: Elizabeth
97.Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston
97.Outline: A film of the early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

98.Name: Saving Mr. Banks
98.Credit: Dir: John Lee Hancock With: Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Annie Rose Buckley
98.Outline: Author P.L. Travers reflects on her childhood after reluctantly meeting with Walt Disney , who seeks to adapt her Mary Poppins books for the big screen.

99.Name: Trumbo
99.Credit: Dir: Jay Roach With: Bryan Cranston, Diane Lane, Helen Mirren
99.Outline: In 1947, Dalton Trumbo was Hollywood's top screenwriter, until he and other artists were jailed and blacklisted for their political beliefs.

100.Name: Freedom Writers
100.Credit: Dir: Richard LaGravenese With: Hilary Swank, Imelda Staunton, Patrick Dempsey
100.Outline: A young teacher inspires her class of at-risk students to learn tolerance, apply themselves, and pursue education beyond high school.

101.Name: American Splendor
101.Credit: Dir: Shari Springer Berman, Robert Pulcini With: Paul Giamatti, Shari Springer Berman, Harvey Pekar
101.Outline: An original mix of fiction and reality illuminates the life of comic book hero everyman Harvey Pekar.

102.Name: Miracle
102.Credit: Dir: Gavin O'Connor With: Kurt Russell, Patricia Clarkson, Nathan West
102.Outline: Miracle tells the true story of Herb Brooks (Russell), the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Russian squad.

103.Name: Fruitvale Station
103.Credit: Dir: Ryan Coogler With: Michael B. Jordan, Melonie Diaz, Octavia Spencer
103.Outline: The story of Oscar Grant III, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident, who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family, and strangers on the last day of 2008.

104.Name: Selma
104.Credit: Dir: Ava DuVernay With: David Oyelowo, Carmen Ejogo, Tim Roth
104.Outline: A chronicle of Martin Luther King 's campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama in 1965.

105.Name: The Aviator
105.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Cate Blanchett, Kate Beckinsale
105.Outline: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes ' career from the late 1920s to the mid-1940s.

106.Name: Heavenly Creatures
106.Credit: Dir: Peter Jackson With: Melanie Lynskey, Kate Winslet, Sarah Peirse
106.Outline: Two girls have an intense fantasy life; their parents, concerned the fantasy is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.

107.Name: Man on the Moon
107.Credit: Dir: Milos Forman With: Jim Carrey, Danny DeVito, Gerry Becker
107.Outline: The life and career of a legendary comedian, Andy Kaufman .

108.Name: The Walk
108.Credit: Dir: Robert Zemeckis With: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Charlotte Le Bon, Guillaume Baillargeon
108.Outline: In 1974, high-wire artist Philippe Petit recruits a team of people to help him realize his dream: to walk the immense void between the World Trade Center towers.

109.Name: Capote
109.Credit: Dir: Bennett Miller With: Philip Seymour Hoffman, Clifton Collins Jr., Catherine Keener
109.Outline: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.

110.Name: Frida
110.Credit: Dir: Julie Taymor With: Salma Hayek, Alfred Molina, Geoffrey Rush
110.Outline: A biography of artist Frida Kahlo, who channeled the pain of a crippling injury and her tempestuous marriage into her work.

111.Name: The Baader Meinhof Complex
111.Credit: Dir: Uli Edel With: Martina Gedeck, Moritz Bleibtreu, Johanna Wokalek
111.Outline: A look at Germany's terrorist group, The Red Army Faction (RAF), which organized bombings, robberies, kidnappings and assassinations in the late 1960s and '70s.

112.Name: Lincoln
112.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn
112.Outline: As the Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

113.Name: 24 Hour Party People
113.Credit: Dir: Michael Winterbottom With: Steve Coogan, Lennie James, John Thomson
113.Outline: In 1976, Tony Wilson sets up Factory Records and brings Manchester's music to the world.

114.Name: Invictus
114.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Morgan Freeman, Matt Damon, Tony Kgoroge
114.Outline: Nelson Mandela, in his first term as the South African President, initiates a unique venture to unite the apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

115.Name: Quills
115.Credit: Dir: Philip Kaufman With: Geoffrey Rush, Kate Winslet, Joaquin Phoenix
115.Outline: In a Napoleonic era insane asylum, an inmate, the irrepressible Marquis De Sade, fights a battle of wills against a tyrannically prudish doctor.

116.Name: The Queen
116.Credit: Dir: Stephen Frears With: Helen Mirren, Michael Sheen, James Cromwell
116.Outline: After the death of Princess Diana , Queen Elizabeth II struggles with her reaction to a sequence of events nobody could have predicted.

117.Name: Rescue Dawn
117.Credit: Dir: Werner Herzog With: Christian Bale, Steve Zahn, Jeremy Davies
117.Outline: A U.S. fighter pilot's epic struggle of survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Viet Nam War.

118.Name: The Way Back
118.Credit: Dir: Peter Weir With: Jim Sturgess, Ed Harris, Colin Farrell
118.Outline: Siberian gulag escapees travel 4,000 miles by foot to freedom in India.

119.Name: Girl, Interrupted
119.Credit: Dir: James Mangold With: Winona Ryder, Angelina Jolie, Clea DuVall
119.Outline: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the 1960s.

120.Name: Woman in Gold
120.Credit: Dir: Simon Curtis With: Helen Mirren, Ryan Reynolds, Daniel BrÃ¼hl
120.Outline: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

121.Name: The Young Victoria
121.Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Paul Bettany
121.Outline: A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.

122.Name: American Sniper
122.Genre: Action | Biography | Drama | History | Thriller | War
122.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Kyle Gallner
122.Outline: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

123.Name: Antwone Fisher
123.Credit: Dir: Denzel Washington With: Denzel Washington, Derek Luke, Joy Bryant
123.Outline: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins.

124.Name: This Boy's Life
124.Credit: Dir: Michael Caton-Jones With: Robert De Niro, Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Barkin
124.Outline: The story about the relationship between a rebellious 50s teenager and his abusive father, based on the memoirs of writer and literature professor Tobias Wolff.

125.Name: The Basketball Diaries
125.Credit: Dir: Scott Kalvert With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Lorraine Bracco, Marilyn Sokol
125.Outline: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

126.Name: Good Morning, Vietnam
126.Credit: Dir: Barry Levinson With: Robin Williams, Forest Whitaker, Tung Thanh Tran
126.Outline: An unorthodox and irreverent DJ begins to shake up things when he is assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam.

127.Name: The People vs. Larry Flynt
127.Credit: Dir: Milos Forman With: Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton
127.Outline: A partially idealized film of the controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech for all people.

128.Name: Monster
128.Credit: Dir: Patty Jenkins With: Charlize Theron, Christina Ricci, Bruce Dern
128.Outline: Based on the life of Aileen Wuornos, a Daytona Beach prostitute who became a serial killer.

129.Name: Mongol: The Rise of Genghis Khan
129.Credit: Dir: Sergey Bodrov With: Tadanobu Asano, Amadu Mamadakov, Khulan Chuluun
129.Outline: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world including Russia in 1206.

130.Name: Steve Jobs
130.Credit: Dir: Danny Boyle With: Michael Fassbender, Kate Winslet, Seth Rogen
130.Outline: Steve Jobs takes us behind the scenes of the digital revolution, to paint a portrait of the man at its epicenter. The story unfolds backstage at three iconic product launches, ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac.

131.Name: Erin Brockovich
131.Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Julia Roberts, Albert Finney, David Brisbin
131.Outline: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

132.Name: Chariots of Fire
132.Credit: Dir: Hugh Hudson With: Ben Cross, Ian Charleson, Nicholas Farrell
132.Outline: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew and the other a devout Christian, compete in the 1924 Olympics.

133.Name: Conviction
133.Credit: Dir: Tony Goldwyn With: Hilary Swank, Sam Rockwell, Melissa Leo
133.Outline: A working mother puts herself through law school in an effort to represent her brother, who has been wrongfully convicted of murder and has exhausted his chances to appeal his conviction through public defenders.

134.Name: The Sessions
134.Credit: Dir: Ben Lewin With: John Hawkes, Helen Hunt, William H. Macy
134.Outline: A man in an iron lung who wishes to lose his virginity contacts a professional sex surrogate with the help of his therapist and priest.

135.Name: Chopper
135.Credit: Dir: Andrew Dominik With: Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field
135.Outline: Chopper tells the intense story of Mark "Chopper" Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison. His book, "From the Inside", upon which the film is based, was a best-seller.

136.Name: Glory Road
136.Credit: Dir: James Gartner With: Josh Lucas, Derek Luke, Austin Nichols
136.Outline: In 1966, Texas Western coach Don Haskins led the first all-black starting line-up for a college basketball team to the NCAA national championship.

137.Name: The Doors
137.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Val Kilmer, Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan
137.Outline: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

138.Name: Che: Part One
138.Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Julia Ormond, Benicio Del Toro, Oscar Isaac
138.Outline: In 1956, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara and a band of Castro-led Cuban exiles mobilize an army to topple the regime of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

139.Name: Out of Africa
139.Credit: Dir: Sydney Pollack With: Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Klaus Maria Brandauer
139.Outline: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

140.Name: Born on the Fourth of July
140.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Tom Cruise, Raymond J. Barry, Caroline Kava
140.Outline: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country he fought for.

141.Name: Unbroken
141.Credit: Dir: Angelina Jolie With: Jack O'Connell, Miyavi, Domhnall Gleeson
141.Outline: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

142.Name: Nowhere Boy
142.Credit: Dir: Sam Taylor-Johnson With: Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Kristin Scott Thomas, Anne-Marie Duff
142.Outline: A chronicle of John Lennon's first years, focused mainly in his adolescence and his relationship with his stern aunt Mimi, who raised him, and his absentee mother Julia, who re-entered his life at a crucial moment in his young life.

143.Name: Men of Honor
143.Credit: Dir: George Tillman Jr. With: Cuba Gooding Jr., Robert De Niro, Charlize Theron
143.Outline: The story of Carl Brashear, the first African American, then also the first amputee, US Navy Diver and the man who trained him.

144.Name: Kill the Irishman
144.Credit: Dir: Jonathan Hensleigh With: Ray Stevenson, Christopher Walken, Vincent D'Onofrio
144.Outline: The true story of Danny Greene, a tough Irish thug working for mobsters in Cleveland during the 1970's.

145.Name: Lee Daniels' The Butler
145.Credit: Dir: Lee Daniels With: Forest Whitaker, Oprah Winfrey, John Cusack
145.Outline: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.

146.Name: Wild
146.Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Reese Witherspoon, Laura Dern, Gaby Hoffmann
146.Outline: A chronicle of one woman's 1,100-mile solo hike undertaken as a way to recover from a recent personal tragedy.

147.Name: The Legend Is Born: Ip Man
147.Credit: Dir: Herman Yau With: Yu-Hang To, Yi Huang, Biao Yuen
147.Outline: Yip Man's resistance against invading foreigners, along with his romantic relations while under the tutelage of three Wing Chun masters.

148.Name: Margin Call
148.Credit: Dir: J.C. Chandor With: Zachary Quinto, Stanley Tucci, Kevin Spacey
148.Outline: Follows the key people at an investment bank, over a 24-hour period, during the early stages of the financial crisis.

149.Name: The Devil's Double
149.Credit: Dir: Lee Tamahori With: Dominic Cooper, Ludivine Sagnier, Raad Rawi
149.Outline: A chilling vision of the House of Saddam Hussein comes to life through the eyes of the man who was forced to become the double of Hussein's sadistic son.

150.Name: Bronson
150.Credit: Dir: Nicolas Winding Refn With: Tom Hardy, Kelly Adams, Luing Andrews
150.Outline: A young man who was sentenced to seven years in prison for robbing a post office ends up spending three decades in solitary confinement. During this time, his own personality is supplanted by his alter-ego, Charles Bronson.

151.Name: Kinsey
151.Credit: Dir: Bill Condon With: Liam Neeson, Laura Linney, Chris O'Donnell
151.Outline: A look at the life of Alfred Kinsey, a pioneer in the area of human sexuality research, whose 1948 publication "Sexual Behavior in the Human Male" was one of the first recorded works that saw science address sexual behavior.

152.Name: Concussion
152.Credit: Dir: Peter Landesman With: Will Smith, Alec Baldwin, Albert Brooks
152.Outline: In Pittsburgh, accomplished pathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu uncovers the truth about brain damage in football players who suffer repeated concussions in the course of normal play.

153.Name: Lords of Dogtown
153.Credit: Dir: Catherine Hardwicke With: Heath Ledger, Emile Hirsch, Victor Rasuk
153.Outline: The film follows the surf and skateboarding trends that originated in Venice, California during the 1970's.

154.Name: Becoming Jane
154.Credit: Dir: Julian Jarrold With: Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy, Julie Walters
154.Outline: A biographical portrait of a pre-fame Jane Austen and her romance with a young Irishman.

155.Name: Charlie Wilson's War
155.Credit: Dir: Mike Nichols With: Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts, Philip Seymour Hoffman
155.Outline: A drama based on a Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets have some unforeseen and long-reaching effects.

156.Name: The Railway Man
156.Credit: Dir: Jonathan Teplitzky With: Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd
156.Outline: A former British Army officer, who was tormented as a prisoner of war at a Japanese labor camp during World War II, discovers that the man responsible for much of his treatment is still alive and sets out to confront him.

157.Name: Everest
157.Credit: Dir: Baltasar KormÃ¡kur With: Jason Clarke, Ang Phula Sherpa, Thomas M. Wright
157.Outline: A climbing expedition on Mt. Everest is devastated by a severe snow storm.

158.Name: Soul Surfer
158.Credit: Dir: Sean McNamara With: AnnaSophia Robb, Dennis Quaid, Helen Hunt
158.Outline: Teenage surfer Bethany Hamilton overcomes the odds and her own fears of returning to the water after losing her left arm in a shark attack.

159.Name: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
159.Genre: Biography | Comedy | Crime | Drama | Romance | Thriller
159.Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: Sam Rockwell, Drew Barrymore, George Clooney
159.Outline: An adaptation of the cult memoir of game show impresario Chuck Barris, in which he purports to have been a CIA hitman.

160.Name: Invincible
160.Credit: Dir: Ericson Core With: Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear, Elizabeth Banks
160.Outline: Based on the story of Vince Papale, a 30-year-old bartender from South Philadelphia who overcame long odds to play for the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles in 1976.

161.Name: Find Me Guilty
161.Credit: Dir: Sidney Lumet With: Vin Diesel, Peter Dinklage, Ron Silver
161.Outline: Based on the true story of Jack DiNorscio, a mobster who defended himself in court for what would be the longest mafia trial in U.S. history.

162.Name: Million Dollar Arm
162.Credit: Dir: Craig Gillespie With: Jon Hamm, Aasif Mandvi, Alan Arkin
162.Outline: A sports agent stages an unconventional recruitment strategy to get talented Indian cricket players to play Major League Baseball.

163.Name: Alive
163.Credit: Dir: Frank Marshall With: Ethan Hawke, Vincent Spano, Josh Hamilton
163.Outline: Uruguayan rugby team stranded in the snow swept Andes are forced to use desperate measures to survive after a plane crash.

164.Name: Foxcatcher
164.Credit: Dir: Bennett Miller With: Steve Carell, Channing Tatum, Mark Ruffalo
164.Outline: Mark and Dave Schultz, U.S. Olympic Wrestling champions, join Team Foxcatcher led by multimillionaire John E. du Pont as they train for the 1988 games in Seoul - but John's emotional self-destruction threatens to consume them all.

165.Name: Breach
165.Credit: Dir: Billy Ray With: Chris Cooper, Ryan Phillippe, Dennis Haysbert
165.Outline: FBI upstart Eric O'Neill enters into a power game with his boss, Robert Hanssen, an agent who was put on trial for selling secrets to the Soviet Union.

166.Name: The Danish Girl
166.Credit: Dir: Tom Hooper With: Eddie Redmayne, Alicia Vikander, Amber Heard
166.Outline: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.

167.Name: Seven Years in Tibet
167.Credit: Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud With: Brad Pitt, David Thewlis, BD Wong
167.Outline: True story of Heinrich Harrer, an Austrian mountain climber who became friends with the Dalai Lama at the time of China's takeover of Tibet.

168.Name: Legend
168.Credit: Dir: Brian Helgeland With: Tom Hardy, Emily Browning, Taron Egerton
168.Outline: The film tells the story of the identical twin gangsters Reggie and Ronnie Kray, two of the most notorious criminals in British history, and their organised crime empire in the East End of London during the 1960s.

169.Name: Julie & Julia
169.Credit: Dir: Nora Ephron With: Amy Adams, Meryl Streep, Chris Messina
169.Outline: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.

170.Name: Public Enemies
170.Credit: Dir: Michael Mann With: Christian Bale, Johnny Depp, David Wenham
170.Outline: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.

171.Name: Black Mass
171.Credit: Dir: Scott Cooper With: Johnny Depp, Benedict Cumberbatch, Dakota Johnson
171.Outline: The true story of Whitey Bulger, the brother of a state senator and the most infamous violent criminal in the history of South Boston, who became an FBI informant to take down a Mafia family invading his turf.

172.Name: My Week with Marilyn
172.Credit: Dir: Simon Curtis With: Michelle Williams, Eddie Redmayne, Kenneth Branagh
172.Outline: Colin Clark, an employee of Sir Laurence Olivier 's, documents the tense interaction between Olivier and Marilyn Monroe during the production of The Prince and the Showgirl .

173.Name: The Prince of Egypt
173.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Biography | Drama | Family | Fantasy | Musical
173.Credit: Dir: Brenda Chapman, Steve Hickner With: Val Kilmer, Ralph Fiennes, Michelle Pfeiffer
173.Outline: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and, later his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

174.Name: I'm Not There.
174.Credit: Dir: Todd Haynes With: Christian Bale, Cate Blanchett, Heath Ledger
174.Outline: Ruminations on the life of Bob Dylan, where six characters embody a different aspect of the musician's life and work.

175.Name: In the Heart of the Sea
175.Genre: Action | Adventure | Biography | Drama | History | Thriller
175.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Brendan Gleeson
175.Outline: A recounting of a New England whaling ship's sinking by a giant whale in 1820, an experience that later inspired the great novel Moby-Dick.

176.Name: Girl with a Pearl Earring
176.Credit: Dir: Peter Webber With: Scarlett Johansson, Colin Firth, Tom Wilkinson
176.Outline: A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.

177.Name: Big Eyes
177.Credit: Dir: Tim Burton With: Amy Adams, Christoph Waltz, Danny Huston
177.Outline: A drama about the awakening of the painter Margaret Keane, her phenomenal success in the 1950s, and the subsequent legal difficulties she had with her husband, who claimed credit for her works in the 1960s.

178.Name: Kill the Messenger
178.Credit: Dir: Michael Cuesta With: Jeremy Renner, Robert Patrick, Jena Sims
178.Outline: Based on the True story of Journalist Gary Webb. The film takes place in the mid 1990s, when Webb uncovered...

179.Name: Radio
179.Credit: Dir: Michael Tollin With: Cuba Gooding Jr., Ed Harris, Debra Winger
179.Outline: The story of a high school coach and the developmentally challenged man whom he took under his wing.

180.Name: Alpha Dog
180.Credit: Dir: Nick Cassavetes With: Emile Hirsch, Justin Timberlake, Anton Yelchin
180.Outline: A drama based on the life of Jesse James Hollywood, a drug dealer who became one of the youngest men ever to be on the FBI's most wanted list.

181.Name: Rob Roy
181.Credit: Dir: Michael Caton-Jones With: Liam Neeson, Jessica Lange, John Hurt
181.Outline: In the highlands of Scotland in the 1700s, Rob Roy tries to lead his small town to a better future,...

182.Name: The Duchess
182.Credit: Dir: Saul Dibb With: Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper
182.Outline: A chronicle of the life of 18th century aristocrat Georgiana, Duchess of Devonshire, who was reviled for her extravagant political and personal life.

183.Name: Che: Part Two
183.Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: DemiÃ¡n Bichir, Rodrigo Santoro, Benicio Del Toro
183.Outline: In 1967, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara leads a small partisan army to fight an ill-fated revolutionary guerrilla war in Bolivia, South America.

184.Name: The Iceman
184.Credit: Dir: Ariel Vromen With: Michael Shannon, Chris Evans, James Franco
184.Outline: The story of Richard Kuklinski, the notorious contract killer and family man. When finally arrested in 1986, neither his wife nor daughters have any clue about his real profession.

185.Name: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
185.Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush
185.Outline: A mature Queen Elizabeth endures multiple crises late in her reign including court intrigues, an assassination plot, the Spanish Armada, and romantic disappointments.

186.Name: Hitchcock
186.Credit: Dir: Sacha Gervasi With: Anthony Hopkins, Helen Mirren, Scarlett Johansson
186.Outline: A love story between the influential filmmaker Alfred Hitchcock and his wife Alma Reville during the filming of Psycho in 1959.

187.Name: Thirteen
187.Credit: Dir: Catherine Hardwicke With: Evan Rachel Wood, Holly Hunter, Nikki Reed
187.Outline: A thirteen-year-old girl's relationship with her mother is put to the test as she discovers drugs, sex, and petty crime in the company of her cool but troubled best friend.

188.Name: Private Parts
188.Credit: Dir: Betty Thomas With: Howard Stern, Mary McCormack, Robin Quivers
188.Outline: The autobiographical story of Howard Stern, the radio rebel who is now also a TV personality, an author and a movie star.

189.Name: Machine Gun Preacher
189.Credit: Dir: Marc Forster With: Gerard Butler, Michelle Monaghan, Michael Shannon
189.Outline: Sam Childers is a former drug-dealing biker tough guy who found God and became a crusader for hundreds of Sudanese children who've been forced to become soldiers.

190.Name: Fair Game
190.Credit: Dir: Doug Liman With: Naomi Watts, Sean Penn, Sonya Davison
190.Outline: CIA operative Valerie Plame discovers her identity is allegedly leaked by the government as payback for an op-ed article her husband wrote criticizing the Bush administration.

191.Name: Bloodsport
191.Credit: Dir: Newt Arnold With: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres
191.Outline: Follows Frank Dux, an American martial artist serving in the military, who decides to leave the army to compete in a martial arts tournament in Hong Kong where fights to the death can occur.

192.Name: Ali
192.Credit: Dir: Michael Mann With: Will Smith, Jamie Foxx, Jon Voight
192.Outline: A biography of sports legend, Muhammad Ali, from his early days to his days in the ring.

193.Name: The Other Boleyn Girl
193.Credit: Dir: Justin Chadwick With: Natalie Portman, Scarlett Johansson, Eric Bana
193.Outline: Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.

194.Name: The Soloist
194.Credit: Dir: Joe Wright With: Jamie Foxx, Robert Downey Jr., Catherine Keener
194.Outline: A Los Angeles journalist befriends a homeless Juilliard-trained musician, while looking for a new article for the paper.

195.Name: The New World
195.Credit: Dir: Terrence Malick With: Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christopher Plummer
195.Outline: The story of the English exploration of Virginia, and of the changing world and loves of Pocahontas.

196.Name: Coco Before Chanel
196.Credit: Dir: Anne Fontaine With: Audrey Tautou, BenoÃ®t Poelvoorde, Alessandro Nivola
196.Outline: The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world.

197.Name: Patch Adams
197.Credit: Dir: Tom Shadyac With: Robin Williams, Daniel London, Monica Potter
197.Outline: The true story of a heroic man, Hunter Patch Adams, determined to become a medical doctor because he enjoys helping people. He ventured where no doctor had ventured before, using humour and pathos.

198.Name: I Love You Phillip Morris
198.Credit: Dir: Glenn Ficarra, John Requa With: Jim Carrey, Ewan McGregor, Leslie Mann
198.Outline: A cop turns con man once he comes out of the closet. Once imprisoned, he meets the second love of his life, whom he'll stop at nothing to be with.

199.Name: Wyatt Earp
199.Credit: Dir: Lawrence Kasdan With: Kevin Costner, Dennis Quaid, Gene Hackman
199.Outline: Wyatt Earp is a movie about a man and his family. The movie shows us the good times and the bad times of one of the West's most famous individuals.

200.Name: Notorious
200.Credit: Dir: George Tillman Jr. With: Jamal Woolard, Anthony Mackie, Derek Luke
200.Outline: The life and death story of Notorious B.I.G. (a.k.a. Christopher Wallace), who came straight out of Brooklyn to take the world of rap music by storm.

201.Name: Joy
201.Credit: Dir: David O. Russell With: Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro, Bradley Cooper
201.Outline: Joy is the story of the title character, who rose to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty.

202.Name: J. Edgar
202.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Armie Hammer, Naomi Watts
202.Outline: J. Edgar Hoover, powerful head of the F.B.I. for nearly 50 years, looks back on his professional and personal life.

203.Name: The Runaways
203.Credit: Dir: Floria Sigismondi With: Kristen Stewart, Dakota Fanning, Michael Shannon
203.Outline: A coming-of-age biographical film about the 1970s teenage all-girl rock band The Runaways. This film also explores the relationship between band members Joan Jett and Cherie Currie.

204.Name: Hollywoodland
204.Genre: Biography | Crime | Drama | History | Mystery | Romance | Thriller
204.Credit: Dir: Allen Coulter With: Adrien Brody, Ben Affleck, Diane Lane
204.Outline: A detective examines the mysterious death of George Reeves , the star of the television series Adventures of Superman .

205.Name: A Dangerous Method
205.Credit: Dir: David Cronenberg With: Michael Fassbender, Keira Knightley, Viggo Mortensen
205.Outline: A look at how the intense relationship between Carl Jung and Sigmund Freud gives birth to psychoanalysis.

206.Name: Marie Antoinette
206.Credit: Dir: Sofia Coppola With: Kirsten Dunst, Jason Schwartzman, Rip Torn
206.Outline: The retelling of France's iconic but ill-fated queen, Marie Antoinette. From her betrothal and marriage to Louis XVI at 15 to her reign as queen at 19 and to the end of her reign as queen and ultimately the fall of Versailles.

207.Name: The Iron Lady
207.Credit: Dir: Phyllida Lloyd With: Meryl Streep, Jim Broadbent, Richard E. Grant
207.Outline: An elderly Margaret Thatcher talks to the imagined presence of her recently deceased husband as she struggles to come to terms with his death while scenes from her past life, from girlhood to British prime minister, intervene.

208.Name: The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc
208.Credit: Dir: Luc Besson With: Milla Jovovich, John Malkovich, Rab Affleck
208.Outline: A young girl receives a vision that drives her to rid France of its oppressors.

209.Name: Dangerous Minds
209.Credit: Dir: John N. Smith With: Michelle Pfeiffer, George Dzundza, Courtney B. Vance
209.Outline: An ex-Marine turned teacher struggles to connect with her students in an inner city school.

210.Name: W.
210.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Banks, Ioan Gruffudd
210.Outline: A chronicle of the life and presidency of George W. Bush .

211.Name: Evita
211.Credit: Dir: Alan Parker With: Madonna, Jonathan Pryce, Antonio Banderas
211.Outline: The hit musical based on the life of Evita Duarte, a B-picture Argentinian actress who eventually became the wife of Argentinian president Juan PerÃ³n, and the most beloved and hated woman in Argentina.

212.Name: The Fifth Estate
212.Credit: Dir: Bill Condon With: Benedict Cumberbatch, Daniel BrÃ¼hl, Carice van Houten
212.Outline: A dramatic thriller based on real events that reveals the quest to expose the deceptions and corruptions of power that turned an Internet upstart into the 21st century's most fiercely debated organization.

213.Name: Lovelace
213.Credit: Dir: Rob Epstein, Jeffrey Friedman With: Amanda Seyfried, James Franco, Peter Sarsgaard
213.Outline: The story of Linda Lovelace , who is used and abused by the porn industry at the behest of her coercive husband, before taking control of her life.

214.Name: Domino
214.Credit: Dir: Tony Scott With: Keira Knightley, Mickey Rourke, Edgar Ramirez
214.Outline: A recounting of Domino Harvey 's life story. The daughter of actor Laurence Harvey turned away from her career as a Ford model to become a bounty hunter.

215.Name: Jobs
215.Credit: Dir: Joshua Michael Stern With: Ashton Kutcher, Dermot Mulroney, Josh Gad
215.Outline: The story of Steve Jobs' ascension from college dropout into one of the most revered creative entrepreneurs of the 20th century.

216.Name: Open Water
216.Credit: Dir: Chris Kentis With: Blanchard Ryan, Daniel Travis, Saul Stein
216.Outline: When two divers find themselves stranded in the ocean, getting rescued becomes the least of their worries when a frenzy of hungry sharks close in on them.

217.Name: The Bling Ring
217.Credit: Dir: Sofia Coppola With: Katie Chang, Israel Broussard, Emma Watson
217.Outline: Inspired by actual events, a group of fame-obsessed teenagers use the internet to track celebrities' whereabouts in order to rob their homes.

218.Name: Alexander
218.Genre: Action | Adventure | Biography | Drama | History | Romance | War
218.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Colin Farrell, Anthony Hopkins, Rosario Dawson
218.Outline: Alexander, the King of Macedonia and one of the greatest military leaders in the history of warfare, conquers much of the known world.

219.Name: Get Rich or Die Tryin'
219.Credit: Dir: Jim Sheridan With: 50 Cent, Joy Bryant, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje
219.Outline: A tale of an inner city drug dealer who turns away from crime to pursue his passion, rap music.
